snippet: China intensified a propaganda campaign to paper over a split in the Communist Party as hints emerged of the wealth amassed by relatives of Bo Xilai, a deposed official.

byline.original: By MICHAEL WINES and KEITH BRADSHER
byline.contributor: Michael Wines reported from Beijing and Keith Bradsher from Hong Kong. Li Bibo contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: China intensified a propaganda campaign to paper over a split in the Communist Party as hints emerged of the wealth amassed by relatives of Bo Xilai, a deposed official.

headline.seo: Chinese Image-Makers Race to Contain Scandal
headline.main: Chinese Media Fight Scandal Fallout; Focus on Bo’s Family
headline.print_headline: Chinese Image-Makers Race to Contain Scandal
